intro: Anepsa carinata, commonly known as the zigzag or pleated fern, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, pleated leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. Anepsa carinata is often found in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its unique foliage and ornamental value make it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers.
